contributors.contributor: Members of the WebGL working group

mirrors.name: EXT_clip_cull_distance
mirrors.addendum: Cull distance support is optional. This extension may be implemented on top of ANGLE_clip_cull_distance.

Although the extension name is WEBGL_clip_cull_distance, the extension must be enabled with the #extension GL_ANGLE_clip_cull_distance directive, as shown in the sample code, to use the built-ins in shaders.
Likewise the shading language preprocessor #define GL_ANGLE_clip_cull_distance, will be defined to 1 if the extension is supported.

feature.p: Clip and cull distance built-ins are supported in ESSL 3.00 shaders.

If the platform does not support cull distances:
Querying MAX_CULL_DISTANCES_WEBGL and MAX_COMBINED_CLIP_AND_CULL_DISTANCES_WEBGL must return zero.
The built-in shader constants gl_MaxCullDistances and gl_MaxCombinedClipAndCullDistances are defined as zero.
The gl_CullDistance built-in must not be redeclared and may only be used conditionally, see the sample code below.

revision.change: Added addendum that allows for the number of cull distances to be 0.
